pullRequest.title: Define product tests suites as code
pullRequest.bodyText:
Since we are defining test environments as code I think that we should do the same with product test suite definitions.
This PR changes suite definitions from bash scripts to Java code, tying environment implementation with test group definitions, exclusions and inclusions, and other configuration properties.
I've added suite run and suite list commands to the presto-product-tests-launcher/bin/run-launcher.
Usage:
presto-product-tests-launcher/bin/run-launcher suite run --suite suite-2 --suite-config config-cdh5

2020-08-20T16:55:55.981+0200	INFO	main	io.prestosql.tests.product.launcher.cli.SuiteRun	Starting suite 'suite-2' with config 'ConfigCdh5{hadoopBaseImage=Optional[prestodev/cdh5.15-hive], dockerImagesVersion=Optional[30], excludedGroups=[skip_on_cdh, iceberg], excludedTests=[], temptoEnvironmentConfigFile=Optional[/dev/null]}' and test runs:
2020-08-20T16:55:55.982+0200	INFO	main	io.prestosql.tests.product.launcher.cli.SuiteRun	 * environment 'singlenode': groups: [hdfs_no_impersonation, hive_compression], excluded groups: [], tests: [], excluded tests: []
2020-08-20T16:55:55.982+0200	INFO	main	io.prestosql.tests.product.launcher.cli.SuiteRun	 * environment 'singlenode-kerberos-hdfs-no-impersonation': groups: [storage_formats, hdfs_no_impersonation], excluded groups: [], tests: [], excluded tests: []
2020-08-20T16:55:55.982+0200	INFO	main	io.prestosql.tests.product.launcher.cli.SuiteRun	 * environment 'singlenode-hdfs-impersonation': groups: [storage_formats, cli, hdfs_impersonation], excluded groups: [], tests: [], excluded tests: []
2020-08-20T16:55:55.982+0200	INFO	main	io.prestosql.tests.product.launcher.cli.SuiteRun	 * environment 'singlenode-kerberos-hdfs-impersonation': groups: [storage_formats, cli, hdfs_impersonation, authorization, hive_file_header], excluded groups: [], tests: [], excluded tests: []
2020-08-20T16:55:55.983+0200	INFO	main	io.prestosql.tests.product.launcher.cli.SuiteRun	 * environment 'singlenode': groups: [hive_with_external_writes], excluded groups: [], tests: [], excluded tests: []
2020-08-20T16:55:55.983+0200	INFO	main	io.prestosql.tests.product.launcher.cli.SuiteRun	Running test run SuiteTestRun{environment=singlenode, groups=[hdfs_no_impersonation, hive_compression], excludedGroups=[], tests=[], excludedTests=[]} with config ConfigCdh5{hadoopBaseImage=Optional[prestodev/cdh5.15-hive], dockerImagesVersion=Optional[30], excludedGroups=[skip_on_cdh, iceberg], excludedTests=[], temptoEnvironmentConfigFile=Optional[/dev/null]}
2020-08-20T16:55:55.999+0200	INFO	main	io.prestosql.tests.product.launcher.cli.TestRun	Pruning old environment(s)
2020-08-20T16:55:55.999+0200	INFO	main	io.prestosql.tests.product.launcher.env.Environments	Shutting down previous containers

config-cdh5
config-empty
config-hdp3

TODO: Use test groups' constant names in a suite definition.

nodes.bodyText: use job or run consistently
Create EnvironmentOptions.copyOf method and use here
drop the comments like this one eventually.

Why do we need additionalSuites.
Can't we just do
MapBinder<String, Suite> suites = newMapBinder(binder, String.class, Suite.class);
suites.addBinding(...)

in some other module if we need to extend the list?

Do we need translation from suite definition to tempto options?
I think in the suite definition we could instead:
testOnEnvironment(SinglenodeHiveImpersonation.class)
        .withGroups("storage_formats", "hdfs_impersonation")
        .build(),

do something lower-level:
testOnEnvironment(SinglenodeHiveImpersonation.class)
        .withTemptoOptions("-g", "storage_formats,hdfs_impersonation")
        .build(),


the semantic DSL is nice (so we have - on this)
simplicity is nice (we have + on this)
it will allow to easily print proper test run command when suite fails (no translation here needed!)
no change required in this class when tempto gains new options

WDYT?

The config-empty was called "empty" because it did not provide any configs, calling into defaults embedded in test run.
As we go more object way, we should rename it to ConfigDefault?
Maybe we merged SuiteConfig and ConfigDefault into one class ("ConfigDefault" acting as a cofig and base class for config as well -- so that defaults are defaults always)

nodes.bodyText: both test and exclude?
Squash with first commit?

could you extract a few methods here to it is not indented such deeply?
Also we could have some simple unit test for that.
It is not obvious to me what drives the distinction whether we use Logger or PrintStream to generate output for caller.
typo: succeeded
Also please log time in something nicer than nanoseconds. Like (1h 10m 12.343s)
Handle InterruptedException

When I see copyOf I expect it to be static factory method taking argument.
Alternatively you may rename the method to getCopy() or just copy() but I prefere static factory.

applySuiteConfig?
Or another flavour of static copyOf taking two EnvironmentOptions source, SuiteConfig suiteConfig
make ordering of constants, fields, arguments, getters, usages in toString, equals, hashCode, consistent
splitValueFromEnv
why do we need those getters after this change? Can't we just use constants?
why so?
drop this one

commit.message: Product tests suite definitions as code
Change reports dir to contain suite, config and environment name
Remove passing of environment settings using ENV
